thread.title: Well-known civic activist shot dead in her Powelton home
thread.title_full: Well-known civic activist shot dead in her Powelton home

author: Julie Shaw
title: Well-known civic activist shot dead in her Powelton home
text:
Well-known civic activist shot dead in her Powelton home Updated: February 4, 2017 — 1:56 PM EST 42 Share Julie Shaw Staff writer 
Julie Shaw works on the Real Time News Desk for the Inquirer and the Daily News. During her 10-plus years at both papers, she has covered the courts, crime, immigration, and census stories. More by Julie Shaw 
A well-known civic activist was found shot to death Friday night in her home in the Powelton section of Philadelp hia, police said Saturday. 
Police did not identify the victim, but a police source said she was a well-known civic activist. 
Friends of the victim identified her as Winnie Harris, who is listed as a program and volunteer coordinator at UC Green , a West Philadelphia-based group that plants and tends trees. 
Police said that about 8:20 p.m., officers responded to a report of a ‘hospital case’ on the 300 block of North Holly Street. There, they found the woman unresponsive in a second-floor front bedroom of a residence, suffering from a gunshot wound to her abdomen. Medics pronounced her dead at the scene at 8:57 p.m. Friday. Police said she was 65 years old. 
The motive for the shooting was unknown. No arrest has been reported. More Coverage
